sentences.en: a piece of toast
sentences.cn: 一块烤面包片

sentences.en: a toast to the bride and groom
sentences.cn: 向新娘新郎祝酒

sentences.en: All of us drank a toast to the bride and bridegroom.
sentences.cn: 大伙向新娘新郎敬酒.

sentences.en: He filled everyone's cup and proposed a toast to the guests.
sentences.cn: 他给每个人满上了酒,建议为来宾们干一杯.

sentences.en: He was choking on a piece of toast.
sentences.cn: 他被一块烤面包噎得透不过气来。

sentences.en: I burnt the toast.
sentences.cn: 我把面包烤糊了。

sentences.en: I dropped my toast, but luckily it fell right side up.
sentences.cn: 我把吐司掉到地上了, 不过幸好它正面朝上.

sentences.en: I had a piece of toast for breakfast
sentences.cn: 我早饭吃了一片吐司。

sentences.en: I had a piece of toast for breakfast.
sentences.cn: 我早饭吃了一片吐司。

sentences.en: I had toast and marmalade this morning.
sentences.cn: 今天早晨我吃的是烤面包加果酱.

sentences.en: I toasted the cheese sandwiches.
sentences.cn: 我烤了干酪三明治。

sentences.en: I’d like to propose a toast (= ask people to drink a toast ) to the bride and groom.
sentences.cn: 我提议为新郎新娘干杯。

sentences.en: Lavalais raised his glass to propose a toast to the newlyweds.
sentences.cn: 拉瓦雷举起酒杯，提议为新婚夫妇干杯。

sentences.en: Make the toast and scramble the eggs.
sentences.cn: 把面包烤一下并炒些鸡蛋。

sentences.en: one mistake and you're toast.
sentences.cn: 只要犯一个错误，你就完了。

sentences.en: She was the toast of Paris.
sentences.cn: 她是巴黎最受推崇的人。

sentences.en: The bridegroom ended his speech by proposing a toast to the hosts.
sentences.cn: 新郎向主人敬酒结束了他的讲话.

sentences.en: The old man was the toast of the whole neighbourhood.
sentences.cn: 这老人受到邻里的交口称赞.

sentences.en: They toasted the birth of their new baby with champagne.
sentences.cn: 他们用香槟酒庆贺自己孩子的出生。

sentences.en: Toast the bread lightly on both sides.
sentences.cn: 稍稍烘烤面包两面。

sentences.en: We had toast and jelly at breakfast.
sentences.cn: 我们早餐吃的是烤面包和果冻.

words.tran_cn: 烤面包器，烤箱；祝酒人；烤面包的人
宴会主持人，主持人；致敬酒辞者，祝酒提议人

phrases.tran_cn: (非正式，主北美)完蛋了，倒霉了
祝酒，敬酒；做一片土司面包

trans.tran_cn: 吐司，干杯，深受推崇的人
trans.tran_en: bread that has been heated so that it is brown on both sides and no longer soft
to make bread or other food brown by placing it close to heat

trans.tran_cn: 烘， 烤； 向…祝酒， 为…干杯
trans.tran_en: to drink a glass of wine etc to thank some-one, wish someone luck, or celebrate something
